item.title: Return
item.description:
I avoided the pen and paper for so long
It was the only thing, which would bring you back
And feeling your presence would be so wrong
And the illustration of the only thing I lack
My pen missed and longed for my hand
And my paper was tired and white
But going back to the lost and familiar land
I could not bear for my emotions to be so bright

I’ve fought for my right to forget
To let go of memories that turned into nothing more
But closure and clarity, I just would not get
And my hands, oh my hands, they were so sore

They were always longing for something
But my head was weary and only wanted to fight
But that something, even you could not bring
Because you were no longer associated with light

Closure, clarity I’ve learned to let go
Because freedom was too high a price to pay
And forgiveness. I probably won’t be able to do so
But it gets better day-by-day

And one sunshiny morning
Alone with my cup of tea
My pen and paper will start to sing
Because their poet has come back to be

item.title: Seven
item.description:
On love & numbers

7 can only be divided by 7 and by 1
7 can only be controlled by 7 and by 1
7 has a heart
7’s heart can only be touched by 7 and by 1
Every number from 0 to 7
And from 7 to infinity
Has a heart
Which can be touched
By a different one
I think we all know who 1 is
I have a 1
You have a 1
You probably don’t have a 1
But you’re looking for a 1
1 is the number that no matter
How many numbers you add to the
List of numbers you know,
That 1 will always stand out
1 is the number that no matter how much
The distance increases between you and 1
Something will always pull you back to that 1
7 has dreams
7 hopes to some day become as big as 77
Or maybe one day increase exponentially
To a number beyond the understanding of mathematical definitions
To infinity
But even 77
Divided by 11
Will go back to 7
And 7 only needs 1
And 7 only loves 1
And although 7 can be divided by 1
1 does not make 7 small or not whole
1 does not change 7
But rather
1 allows 7 to remain 7
But a better version of 7
And in a world where being prime
Has become quite odd

item.title: Revolution
item.description:
On Women & Revolutions

Let the woman in you roar
Because for too long, she’s been silenced
Let the woman in you fight
Because they expected you to always be frightened
Let the woman in you scream
Because your country needs you to fight today
Let the woman in you glow
Because without you, this revolution is so grey

Rise from the ashes because
For too long, too much has been taken from you
Rise from the ashes and see
This land is for me & for you too
Rise from the ashes and say
Unity, unity what a beautiful view
Rise from the ashes and see
Your hopes will never again be so few

This revolution is female
And our rightful future we will declare
This revolution is inclusive
For too long, they’ve made us question our own flair
This revolution is fearless
And our leadership, they will have to endure
This revolution is endless
That, my determination can assure

item.title: Mother
item.description:
On Heroes

As I was growing up
My favorite Super Hero was my Mother
Actually, it was Blossom from powerpuff girls
But it should have been my mother
Because
No one describes heroism better than
The person who pretends she doesn’t want that last piece of cake
Though she is starving
And that cake looks so damn delicious
And I know this feels like something you may have read off Facebook
Maybe because I read it off Facebook myself
Forgive me Mother but
It always baffles me how I can find the perfect poem
To talk about love
In all its different shapes and sizes
Except when it comes to you
It baffles me how I can find the perfect words
In every situation
In every occasion
But no words I find are enough
When it comes to
Describing how heroic you are, mother
Describing how beautiful your smile is, mother
Describing how you are the definition of a blessing, mother
You smile is contagious
It overflows
Every time I see you cry
Because the world is too messed up
Or because someone just died in the movie you were watching
Or because you were watching the news and Lebanon is breaking your heart
g to my room to talk to me and I just wasn’t in a good enough
Everytime I see you cry
I wish
More than anything
That I could be the hero that you are
And chase that sadness away from you
And ruin every little thing that makes you sad
Your resilience is contagious
It overflows
You grew up at a time where it took
Risking your life to go from one town to another
You grew up at a time where it took
Risking your life in order to get your college degree
Yet, you are not angry
Not bitter
You wake up everyday looking for the sunshine
In every ounce of darkness
You wake up everyday as a form of praise
Regarding a life filled with struggle
Yet you still eloquently win the battle
Against the darkness of the world
Your love is contagious
It overflows
Everytime I feel like my life is black and grey
You are red
You are pink and you are radiant
And every shiny color there is
Mother, I apologize for every single time
I was too blind to see
The cape you wear on your shoulder
Every morning after you wake up at 6am
And the halo you wear on your head
Every night after you spend the day
Fighting for goodness
Against evil
Mother, I am sorry that every time they used to ask me
Who my favorite super hero was
I was too blind to say it was my mother.
